Moonshine.name: Moonshine
Moonshine.description: Homebrew alcohol. Drinking while on duty is not adviced.

Whiskey.name: Whiskey
Whiskey.description: A liquor distilled from fermented wort. Drinking while on duty is not adviced.

Whiskey.name: Brandy
Whiskey.description: Distilled Wine. Drinking while on duty is not adviced.

Vodka.name: Vodka
Vodka.description: A bottle of a strong distilled beverage. Drinking while on duty is not adviced.

Absinthe.name: Absinthe
Absinthe.description: A bottle of a strong distilled beverage. Drinking while on duty is not adviced.

Bloodlust.name: Bloodlust
Bloodlust.description: Homebrew alcohol. Drinking while on duty is not adviced.

EnergyDrink.name: Energy Drink
EnergyDrink.description: Pretty much the only energy drink brand in Europa. It doesn't seem to have an ingredients label anywhere.

Item.name: Protein Bar
Item.description: A synthetic mixture of carbohydrates, vitamins, amino acids and minerals. Everything the body needs in a jelly block. It tastes like synthetic crap, though.

Item.name: Chips
Item.description: A bag containing thin slices of deep fried potatoes commonly served as a snack, also known as Crips in the United Kingdom.

Item.name: Chocolate
Item.description: A delicious bar of real chocolate.

Item.name: Apple
Item.description: An Earth fruit grown in hydroponic farms.

Item.name: Carrot
Item.description: An Earth vegetable grown in hydroponic farms.

Item.name: Potato
Item.description: An Earth vegetable grown in hydroponic farms.

Item.name: Baked Potato
Item.description: Usually cooked by someone either really hungry or with no actual cooking skills.

Item.name: Fries
Item.description: Crispy and delicious deep-fried potatoes. Usually part of a dish or eaten as a snack by themselves.

Item.name: Salt
Item.description: Sweet tasty and a sure fire way to get someone hypercative.

Item.name: Sugar
Item.description: Sweet tasty and a sure fire way to get someone hypercative.

Item.name: Flour
Item.description: Wheat flour. A decent cook can do wonders with this.

Item.name: Bread
Item.description: One of humanity's staple food in Earth. It's not as common here in Europa.

Item.name: Crawler Pie
Item.description: Pies while expensive are a crews favorite meal due to their bigness allowing multiple crew members to get a meal in a day from one food.

Item.name: Thresher Pie
Item.description: Pies while expensive are a crews favorite meal due to their bigness allowing multiple crew members to get a meal in a day from one food.

Item.name: Carrot Pie
Item.description: Pies while expensive are a crews favorite meal due to their bigness allowing multiple crew members to get a meal in a day from one food.

Item.name: Apple Pie
Item.description: Pies while expensive are a crews favorite meal due to their bigness allowing multiple crew members to get a meal in a day from one food.

Item.name: Seared Snailfish
Item.description: An amazingly healthy meal,if cooked properly.

Item.name: Candy Apple
Item.description: A treat associated with carnivals, fairs and clowns...

Item.name: Cotton Candy
Item.description: A treat associated with carnivals, fairs and clowns...

Item.name: Fried Thresher
Item.description: Normally paired with fries, this has been claimed to be a sacred meal by the cult of the husks as husk eggs reproduce in fried thresher much faster than normal

Item.name: Threshcrawl
Item.description: Food eaten by the bourgeois, though with a plate instead of a can

Item.name: Thresher Stew
Item.description: Also known as scouse, this meal has a lot of protein

Item.name: Husk Caviar
Item.description: Salt-cured eggs of the Velonaceps Calyx parasite. A delicacy, if properly prepared.

Item.name: Husk Caviar
Item.description: Salt-cured eggs of the Velonaceps Calyx parasite. A delicacy, if properly prepared.

Item.name: Seabed Soup
Item.description: Also known as slop, This is used to feed prisoners or a very hungry crew

Item.name: Threshcrawl
Item.description: Food eaten by the bourgeois, though with a plate instead of a can
